content.description:
A powerful problem with two nasty razor edges which are used to leap to a desperate hold just below the top.

Sit start low in a two hand finger pocket and reach for the razor thin edges. Shoot for a small crimp up and left, control the swing and slap your way over the edge.   Do not move right into the Coyote Crack.
content.location: Just left of the Coyote Crack

content.description:
A traverse along the rounded lip/arete of the Coyote boulder.

Sit start on the left edge of the boulder and traverse the lip to the top of the Coyote crack. Could use a little lovin scrubbin.
content.protection: Pads and goggles for the sand.
content.location: Left side of the Coyote boulder.

content.description:
Known by many different names over the years, Coyote Crack was the oldest known one I could find. Perhaps you know one from before the late 90’s?

This route is sure to stop any climber in their tracks when viewed from the road. A splitter crack system through a steep flat wall complete with perfect square cut edges, pockets and finger locks. What’s not to love about this one.

Sit start with your hands on a perfect horizontal rail. Move up into the crack using a variety of holds to a glory finger lock just before reaching the jug at the top. Mantle over the lip and you’re done. All on an immaculate face of bullet hard stone.
A low stand start on some not so great holds and leap for a huge jug. Now slap upthe short arete above and claw your way over the top. Harder than it looks.
content.location: Just Right of the Coyote Crack
